channel.title: Dan Cunning - dan.cunning.cc
channel.description: A Ruby on Rails contractor's writes about his meandering thoughts

item.title: Minimum Viable Test Suite
item.description: Ensure your test suite doesn't have any important holes in coverage by enforcing a simple rule.

item.title: Loading Buttons
item.description: Converting action buttons into loading buttons is a common way for AJAX applications indicate that it's waiting on the server to verify an action and respond.

item.title: Followed Actors & Directors
item.description: People who consistently help make movies they're involved in worth watching or just people I like watching in movies.

item.title: TV Shows = Great Ringtones
item.description: List of songs from television shows that make great ringtones.

item.title: Private Photo Albums
item.description: Share and organize pictures with my family while balancing privacy, ownership, simplicity, and convenience.

item.title: Browsing Files & Directories in S3
item.description: Amazon's S3 makes storing files easy but viewing directories isn't intuitive. Let me explain how you can emulate a file structure using Plain-Old-Ruby-Objects.

item.title: NFL Salaries by College
item.description: Ranking each NCAA football conference and school on how much their former players make in the NFL.

item.title: NCAAF Vegas Bias
item.description: Determining which college football programs are under or over valued against the spreads, moneylines, and over/unders.

item.title: 2014 NCAAF Vegas Bias
item.description: What programs were under and over valued by Sportsbooks in the 2014 college football season?

item.title: 2015 NCAAF Vegas Bias
item.description: What programs were under and over valued by Sportsbooks in the 2015 college football season?

item.title: Progress Bars
item.description: How to create a progress bar using Ruby on Rails, AJAX, and Twitter Bootstrap.

item.title: Gilmore Girls Alumni
item.description: A look at the cast members that gained significant fame after Gilmore Girls.

item.title: A More Representative Democracy
item.description: An outline for how a simple website could solve many of the problems with our current legislative systems.

item.title: f.label and errors.full_messages
item.description: Why you should never use the explicit "content" parameter of label_tag or the form builder's label method.

item.title: Time Zones and datetime_select
item.description: A simple fix for using datetime_select and time_zone_select together.

item.title: views/mailers directory
item.description: Avoid cluttering up app/views by moving mailer directories underneath a single parent.

item.title: Mailing Lists
item.description: Mailing lists remain an effective way for groups to communicate. We'll explore how to implement them in your Rails application to improve its overall user-experience.

item.title: Learning to Draw
item.description: After college I found myself with more free time than I needed, so I decided to learn to draw. Here's how I went about it along with a small gallery.

item.title: The Communication Age
item.description: The explosion of the Internet and mobile devices shaped a new age where people across the globe are always connected and always communicating, irreversibly changing the way we meet, work, govern, and socialize.

item.title: Firefox Remote Control
item.description: Controlling your TV with your iPhone via OSX, Firefox, and an HDMI cable

item.title: "Now Streaming" Email
item.description: Find out what's now streaming online with a bi-weekly email digest.

item.title: Fantasy Sportsbook
item.description: Creating a new type of game by combining my favorite elements of sportsbooks and fantasy sports.

item.title: Beware ActiveRecord callbacks
item.description: ActiveRecord is a fantastically well-made ORM that makes working with databases a breeze, but one feature in the callback structure is incredibly bug-prone.

item.title: The Past, Present, and Future of Computers
item.description: Computers have made an undeniably permanent mark on the world, but their success wasn't gained overnight. They slowly improved what they could do, leading to advancements that led to new advancements. Let's look at how they progressed to what they are today and try to predict what they might do in the future.

item.title: Soccer is Aggravating
item.description: Soccer is a world-wide phenomenon, but here's why I find it really hard to watch.

item.title: Infinite Scrolling with AJAX
item.description: Ruby on Rails and jQuery team up to allow your visitors to scroll through all your content without initially loading them all.

item.title: Why the Thrashers left Atlanta
item.description: Atlanta has become a hockey punchline. We've lost two NHL franchises: the Flames in 1980 and the Thrashers in 2011. Here's why the Thrashers leaving had more to do with America Online than with the city or its hockey fans.

item.title: Finding Your Most Active Users
item.description: Google Analytics is normally used to track a website's visitors and pageviews, but it can also track specific users, which can be invaluable information as you develop your customer base. Who is the most active? What are they using? Whose usage is fading?

item.title: Ajax Toggle Buttons
item.description: How to create toggle buttons using Ruby on Rails, ajax, and unobtrusive javascript. Straight-forward and boring, just how I like it.

item.title: Fixing Craigslist
item.description: Fixing Craigslist search by filtering posts, aggregating multiple searches, grouping together and emailing important posts.

item.title: NCAAF Interconference Records
item.description: Complete list of inter-conference games since 1998 (the BCS and playoff eras). Browse the conferences, teams, and years to decide whether there's enough evidence for a "better conference".

item.title: College Football Conference Records in Bowls
Enjoyable Music Videos
item.description: List of music videos that I enjoyed over the years and don't want to forget for some reason. Maybe you'll find a couple to enjoy?

item.title: SEC 2012: Season Review
item.description: With the 2012 SEC regular season now complete, let's explore how the two-team expansion gave scheduling a major role in each team's success or failure.

item.title: Don't hate the SEC
item.description: If you're a college football fan from outside the SEC, you may think the SEC is ruining college football, but let me tell you how it could be the opposite.

item.title: Movie Recommendations
item.description: Movies that I enjoyed enough that I think you should look into them. They tend to be unique, covering perspectives and topics I've never seen on screen before.

item.title: Tim Tebow is better than you
item.description: I'm a Broncos fan and people can't stop talking to me about Tim Tebow. Now that his fate as a Bronco is sealed, here's my opinion.

item.title: Smart is Overrated
item.description: Being smart is better than being stupid, but smart shouldn't be the first word you want applied to you. How did smart get so important? How can it work against you? What other traits are more important?

item.title: TV Recommendations
item.description: TV shows I enjoy watching. You may or may not agree, but I suggest you look into some.

item.title: The Tricky World of Using Web APIs
item.description: When your application interacts with the web a lot can go wrong. Working with Ruby on Rails over the last five years, I've seen a lot of them first hand, and with this article I hope to share some of that experience and help you write more reliable, efficient and friendly code.

item.title: Protecting Yourself from Malicious params
item.description: The issues and solutions to making your application's handling of user parameters secure by default, before Ruby on Rails offered an out-of-the-box solution..

item.title: Speaking outside yourself
item.description: Examples of how people commonly avoid personal responsibility in discussions by implying facts or universal truths.

item.title: Get Inspired
item.description: A collection of videos, songs and articles with so much heart and insight they affect me every time I watch. Maybe they'll do the same for you.
